In diatonic set theory a 'specific interval' is the shortest possible clockwise
distance between pitch classes on the chromatic circle (interval class), in
other words the number of half steps between notes. The largest specific
interval is one less than the number of "chromatic" pitches. In twelve tone
equal temperament the largest specific interval is 11. (Johnson 2003, p.26)

Myhill's property is the quality of musical scales or collections with exactly
two specific intervals for every generic interval. In other words, each generic
interval can be made from one of two possible different specific intervals.
